intro: Dendranthema zawadzkii var. lucida, commonly known as the silverleaf fleur-de-lis, is a perennial plant native to Europe. It is characterized by its silvery-white, woolly leaves and showy, daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and disturbed areas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes many other flowering plants. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and floral arrangements.
